method.name: i_cal_time_new

returns.comment: The newly created #ICalTime. It is a null time

method.comment: Creates a new #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_clone
method.comment: Creates a new #ICalTime, copy of @timetype.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_null_time
method.comment: Creates a default time which is an epoch time.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_null_date
method.comment: Creates a null date, which indicates no time has been set.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_current_with_zone

parameter.name: zone
parameter.comment: The timezone used to create a #ICalTime according to the current time

method.comment: Creates a #ICalTime according to the timezone and current time.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_today
method.comment: Creates a #ICalTime representing today.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_from_timet_with_zone

parameter.name: v
parameter.comment: The seconds past since epoch time

parameter.name: is_date
parameter.comment: Whether it is a date type, true if yes, false if not

method.comment: Converts seconds past UNIX epoch to a timetype, using timezones.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_from_string
method.comment: Creates a time from an ISO format string.

method.name: i_cal_time_new_from_day_of_year
method.comment: Creates a new time, given a day of year and a year.

method.name: i_cal_time_as_timet

returns.comment: The time as seconds past the UNIX epoch

method.comment: Returns the time as seconds past the UNIX epoch.

method.name: i_cal_time_as_timet_with_zone

returns.comment: The time as seconds past the UNIX epoch

method.comment: Returns the time as seconds past the UNIX epoch, using timezones.

method.name: i_cal_time_as_ical_string
method.comment: Returns a string representation of the time, in RFC2445 format.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_timezone
method.comment: Returns the timezone, the #ICalTimezone object is cached and can be either unreferenced once the last instance is used or can be kept until i_cal_object_free_global_objects() is called (usually at the very end of the program).

method.name: i_cal_time_set_timezone
method.comment: Sets the timezone of the @tt.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_tzid

returns.comment: The tzid of #ICalTime, or NULL if floating type

method.comment: Returns the tzid, or NULL for a floating time.

method.name: i_cal_time_day_of_year

returns.comment: The day of the year of the given time

method.comment: Returns the day of the year of the given time.

method.name: i_cal_time_day_of_week

returns.comment: The day of the week of the given time. Sunday is 1.

method.comment: Returns the day of the week of the given time. Sunday is 1.

method.name: i_cal_time_start_doy_week

parameter.name: fdow
parameter.comment: The first day of the week

returns.comment: The day of the year for the Sunday of the week that the given time is within.

method.comment: Returns the day of the year for the first day of the week that the given time is within.

method.name: i_cal_time_week_number

returns.comment: The week number for the week the given time is within.

method.comment: Returns the week number for the week the given time is within.

method.name: i_cal_time_is_null_time

returns.comment: Whether @tt is null_time. true if yes, false if not.

method.comment: Returns true if the time is null.

method.name: i_cal_time_is_valid_time

returns.comment: Whether @tt is null_time. true if yes, false if not.

method.comment: Returns true if the time is null.

method.name: i_cal_time_is_date

returns.comment: True if time is of DATE type, false if DATE-TIME.

method.comment: Returns true if time is of DATE type, false if DATE-TIME.

method.name: i_cal_time_is_utc

returns.comment: True if time is relative to UTC zone.

method.comment: Returns true if time is relative to UTC zone.

method.name: i_cal_time_compare

returns.comment: -1, 0, or 1 to indicate that a less than b, a==b or a larger than b.

method.comment: i_cal_time_compare returns an integer indicating the result of the comparison, as follow:

method.name: i_cal_time_compare_date_only

returns.comment: -1, 0, or 1 to indicate that a less than b, a==b or a larger than b.

method.comment: Like i_cal_time_compare(), but only use the date parts.

method.name: i_cal_time_compare_date_only_tz

returns.comment: -1, 0, or 1 to indicate that a less than b, a==b or a larger than b.

method.comment: Like i_cal_time_compare_tz(), but only use the date parts; accepts timezone.

method.name: i_cal_time_adjust
method.comment: Adds or subtracts a number of days, hours, minutes and seconds from @tt.

method.name: i_cal_time_normalize
method.comment: Normalizes the icaltime, so that all fields are within the normal range.

method.name: i_cal_time_normalize_inplace
method.comment: Normalizes the @tt, so that all fields are within the normal range.

method.name: i_cal_time_convert_to_zone
method.comment: Converts @tt to @zone and return new #ICalTime object.

method.name: i_cal_time_convert_to_zone_inplace
method.comment: Converts @tt to @zone and store the result into @tt.

method.name: i_cal_time_days_in_month

returns.comment: The number of days in the target month in the target year.

method.comment: Gets the number of days in the target month in the target year.

method.name: i_cal_time_days_is_leap_year

returns.comment: Whether the @year is a leap year

method.comment: Checks whether a year is a leap year.

method.name: i_cal_time_days_in_year
method.comment: Returns the number of days in this year.

method.name: i_cal_time_span_new
method.comment: Creates a new #ICalTimeSpan.

method.name: i_cal_time_span_overlaps

returns.comment: Whether these two span are overlapped.

method.comment: Checks whether two spans overlap.

method.name: i_cal_time_span_contains

returns.comment: Whether one #ICalTimeSpan is contained in another #ICalTimeSpan.

method.comment: Checks whether one #ICalTimeSpan is contained in another #ICalTimeSpan.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_year
method.comment: Gets the year of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_year
method.comment: Sets the year of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_month
method.comment: Gets the month of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_month
method.comment: Sets the month of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_day
method.comment: Gets the day of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_day
method.comment: Sets the day of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_hour
method.comment: Gets the hour of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_hour
method.comment: Sets the hour of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_minute
method.comment: Gets the minute of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_minute
method.comment: Sets the minute of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_second
method.comment: Gets the second of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_second
method.comment: Sets the second of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_is_date
method.comment: Sets the is_date of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_is_daylight
method.comment: Gets the is_daylight of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_is_daylight
method.comment: Sets the is_daylight of #ICalTime.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_date

parameter.name: year
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'year' part of the date

parameter.name: month
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'month' part of the date

parameter.name: day
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'day' part of the date

method.comment: Gets the year/month/date parts of the @timetype in one call.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_date
method.comment: Sets the year/month/date parts of the @timetype in one call. This doesn't verify validity of the given date.

method.name: i_cal_time_get_time

parameter.name: hour
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'hour' part of the time

parameter.name: minute
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'minute' part of the time

parameter.name: second
parameter.comment: Out parameter for the 'second' part of the time

method.comment: Gets the hour/minute/second parts of the @timetype in one call.

method.name: i_cal_time_set_time
method.comment: Sets the hour/minute/second parts of the @timetype in one call. This doesn't verify validity of the given time.
